Enumeration Type Documentation

enum VehicleFlags

Flags to describe the internal used shape types behavior. This can be done at any time with :

  • building block PVWSet
  • pWheel::setShapeFlags Flags to describe the wheels control facility. This can be done at any time with :

building block PVWSet

  • pWheel::setWheelFlags
enum WheelShapeFlags
Enumerator:
WSF_WheelAxisContactNormal 

Determines whether the suspension axis or the ground contact normal is used for the suspension constraint.

WSF_InputLatSlipVelocity 

If set, the lateral slip velocity is used as the input to the tire function, rather than the slip angle.

WSF_InputLongSlipVelocity 

If set, the longitudinal slip velocity is used as the input to the tire function, rather than the slip ratio.

WSF_UnscaledSpringBehavior 

If set, does not factor out the suspension travel and wheel radius from the spring force computation. This is the legacy behavior from the raycast capsule approach.

WSF_AxleSpeedOverride 

If set, the axle speed is not computed by the simulation but is rather expected to be provided by the user every simulation step via NxWheelShape::setAxleSpeed().

WSF_EmulateLegacyWheel 

If set, the wheels shape will emulate the legacy raycast capsule based wheel. See pVWheelFunction.

WSF_ClampedFriction 

If set, the shape will clamp the force in the friction constraints. See pVWheelFunction.

enum WheelFlags

Flags to describe the wheels control facility. This can be done at any time with :

  • building block PVWSet
  • pWheel::setWheelFlags
Enumerator:
WF_SteerableInput 

If set, the wheels shape will emulate the legacy raycast capsule based wheel. See pVWheelFunction.

enum pVehicleControlStateItem

A abstract base class for a vehicle object.
